朱䴉.definition: (bird species of China) crested ibis (Nipponia nippon)

朱儁.definition: Zhu Jun (-195), politician and general at the end of later Han

朱允炆.definition: Zhu Yuanwen, personal name of second Ming Emperor Jianwen 建文[Jian4 Wen2]

朱元璋.definition: Zhu Yuanzhang, personal name of first Ming dynasty emperor Hongwu 洪武[Hong2 wu3]

朱利亞尼.definition: Giuliani (name); Rudolph W (Rudy) Giuliani (1944-), US Republican politician, Mayor of New York City 1994-2001

朱厚照.definition: Zhu Houzhao, personal name of tenth Ming emperor 正德[Zheng4 de2] (1491-1521), reigned 1505-1521

朱子.definition: Master Zhu, another name for Zhu Xi 朱熹[Zhu1 Xi1]

朱孝天.definition: Ken Zhu (1979-), Taiwanese singer and actor

朱容基.definition: common erroneous form of 朱鎔基|朱镕基, Zhu Rongji (1928-), PRC politician, premier 1998-2003

朱德.definition: Zhu De (1886-1976), communist leader and founder of the People's Liberation Army

朱棣.definition: Zhu Di, personal name of third Ming Emperor Yongle 永樂|永乐[Yong3 le4]

朱溫.definition: Zhu Wen (852-912), military governor 節度使|节度使[jie2 du4 shi3] at the end of Tang, founder of Later Liang of the Five Dynasties (907-923), also known as Emperor Taizu of Later Liang 後梁太祖|后梁太祖[Hou4 Liang2 Tai4 zu3]

朱熔基.definition: common erroneous form of 朱鎔基|朱镕基, Zhu Rongji (1928-), PRC politician, premier 1998-2003

朱熹.definition: Zhu Xi or Chu Hsi (1130-1200), also known as Master Zhu 朱子[Zhu1 zi3], Song dynasty Confucian writer and propagandist, founder of neo-Confucianism

朱由校.definition: personal name of fifteenth Ming emperor Tianqi 明天啟|明天启[Ming2 Tian1 qi3] (1605-1627), reigned 1620-1627

朱瞻基.definition: Zhu Zhanji, personal name of fifth Ming emperor Xuande 宣德[Xuan1 de2]

朱砂.definition: cinnabar; mercuric sulfide HgS; also written 硃砂|朱砂[zhu1 sha1]

朱祁鈺.definition: Zhu Qiyu, personal name of seventh Ming emperor Jingtai 景泰[Jing3 tai4] (1428-1457), reigned 1449-1457

朱祁鎮.definition: Zhu Qizhen, personal name of sixth and eighth Ming emperor Zhengtong 正統|正统[Zheng4 tong3], afterwards Tianshun Emperor 天順|天顺[Tian1 shun4] (1427-1464), reigned 1435-1449 and 1457-1464

朱筆.definition: brush dipped in red ink (used in former times for writing official documents, grading papers etc)

朱粉.definition: red lead oxide Pb3O4; rouge and white lead; cosmetics

朱紅燈.definition: Zhu Hongdeng, one of the leaders of the Boxer Rebellion

朱紱.definition: (archaic) red silk ribbon tied to a seal or a jade pendant; red knee cover, part of an official's robes (also a synedoche for the attire of an official); to be an official

朱背啄花鳥.definition: (bird species of China) scarlet-backed flowerpecker (Dicaeum cruentatum)

朱諾.definition: Juneau, capital of Alaska; Juno, Roman goddess of marriage

朱雲折檻.definition: Mr Zhu Yun breaks the railing (idiom); to challenge and admonish boldly

朱高熾.definition: Zhu Gaochi, personal name of fourth Ming emperor Hongxi 洪熙[Hong2 Xi1]

朱鵐.definition: (bird species of China) Przevalski's finch (Urocynchramus pylzowi)

朱鷺.definition: ibis; Japanese crested ibis (Nipponia nippon); same as 朱䴉|朱鹮[zhu1 huan2]

朱鸝.definition: (bird species of China) maroon oriole (Oriolus traillii)
